title: Pauline Hanson Seizes Coalition Split As One Nation Recruits Former Liberal Party MP | 10 News
description: The political soap-opera engulfing the Liberals and Nationals has taken another turn tonight with some progress being made toward a reunion.  Sussan Ley has laid down a list of her demands as David Littleproud considers his options.  But it's Pauline Hanson seizing on the division, with One Nation recruiting another former Liberal. title: US TV Host Savannah Guthrie’s Elderly Mother Feared Abducted From Arizona Home | 10 News
description: US authorities fear the mother of a US morning show host has been abducted from her Arizona home, in the middle of the night.  Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother lived alone and has mobility issues but hasn't been seen for more than 24-hours, after the discovery of a very concerning crime scene. title: Jacob Elordi And Margot Robbie Talk Wuthering Heights Ahead Of Release | 10 News
description: Getting the chance to play two of British literature's most famous characters has given a couple of famous Queenslanders a reason to smile.  Jacob Elordi and Margot Robbie are playing Heathcliff and Cathy in Wuthering Heights and sat down to talk to Entertainment Editor Angela Bishop before they bring the film home next week. title: Restored Angel Art In Basilica Resembles Italian Prime Minister | 10 News
description: A basilica’s restored angel painting is receiving backlash after churchgoers noticed one of the cherubs resembles Italy’s Prime Minister, Giorgia Meloni.  The nation’s culture ministry and the Diocese of Rome have launched an investigation, but the painter is defending his work.  10’s Late News explains. title: Neo-Nazi Jacob Hersant Reprimanded By Magistrate Over Racist Bunnings Stunt | 10 News
description: Self-proclaimed neo-Nazi Jacob Hersant has been told to wipe the smile off his face by a Melbourne magistrate, while appearing in court charged with being involved in a racist stunt in a Bunnings carpark.  Hersant was part of a group which dressed in offensive clothing during Halloween last year and intimidated young women. title: Volunteer Firefighters Save Cape Jervis As Bushfire Cuts Off Township Near Adelaide | 10 News
description: Volunteer firefighters have risked their lives to stand between a raging bushfire south of Adelaide, and a township cut off by the flames.  Their efforts are credited with saving Cape Jervis.  Jodie Oddy joins us now from Delamere. title: Interest Rate Rise, Mystery Meteor In Aus, Heartwarming Act For Young Cancer Fighter | 10 News+
description: For the first time in two years, the Reserve Bank has made its move to curb spending by Aussies, raising the interest rate from 3.6 per cent to 3.85 per cent. Here’s what it means for your wallet.  There has been a heartwarming turn of events for a young Aussie battling cancer after they were among a group of kids left disappointed by former NBA player Allen Iverson.  The mysterious flying object over Melbourne has been identified after dozens of witnesses described how they saw glowing fragments breaking apart in the sky. title: Disturbing Posters Of Alleged Bondi Shooter Pop Up In Melbourne | 10 News
description: At least 40 disturbing images depicting alleged Bondi terror attack gunman Naveed Akram have been plastered across Melbourne, mimicking the street art series titled “Aussie”.  The city council is scrambling to remove the posters which are believed to have been put up on the Australia Day long weekend. title: Polar Bears Growing Bigger & Healthier Despite Thinning Sea Ice | 10 News
description: Scientists have revealed polar bears are growing fatter and healthier despite thinning sea ice.  The researchers are considering a theory that the bears have adapted to hunting land-based prey previously over-hunted by humans.  10’s Late News explains.
